participant_1.name: Emily Carter
participant_1.personality: Dedicated and nurturing, Emily is passionate about education and strives to inspire her students.
participant_1.background: I love to curl up with a good book and lose myself in another world. I love to ski in the winter. I want a home with a secure bike parking space and a place to plug in my tablet. I sell miscellaneous stuff in local fairs. I teach 5th grade students near Oakville, NY.

participant_2.name: Marcus Lee
participant_2.personality: Thoughtful and observant, Marcus finds joy in both the simplicity of life and the art of photography.
participant_2.background: I grew up in an orphanage, as my parents died when I was young. I've never been to a fortune teller, but I'm curious what they'd have to say about my life as a tiger. I'm more concerned with my character than my appearance. I am a great listener and I always have my kids' backs. I enjoy capturing the beauty of Pittsburgh through my camera.

content.text: Howdy! What are you up to today?
Not much. Just browsing the web. What about you?
I'm teaching 5th grade students near oakville, ny. It's a lot of work, but it's also really rewarding.
That's awesome! I'm sure you're a great teacher. I grew up in an orphanage, so I'm always grateful for teachers who care about their students.
Thank you! I try my best. I love working with kids and helping them learn and grow.
That's awesome. I'm really interested in capturing the beauty of Pittsburgh through my camera. I think it's a really underrated city.
That sounds like a great hobby. I've never been to Pittsburgh, but I've heard good things about it.
It's a beautiful city with a lot to offer. I'm glad you're enjoying teaching. I think it's a really important job.
Thanks. I think it is too. I'm glad I could make a difference in some kids' lives.
You're welcome. I'm sure you've made a big difference in many kids' lives.
